website_summaries.verdict: A decent but not great camera, the megazoom Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18 still manages to outdo its few competitors.
cons: Camera's JPEG processing choices can produce suboptimal results

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time looking for a new digital camera. Somehow I decided on this camera and it's the best decision I could have made. I have no complaints about the camera. It's easy to use, has a good solid feel, but light enough to carry around all day. The zoom is amazing. The pictures I've taken are framable. The stabalization feature makes all the difference when I'm taking pictures of the grandkids as I only have seconds to capture a shot. If you decide to buy this camera, you won't be disappointed. I had also considered a digital SLR, but didn't want to go that complicated, or that cumbersome. Great camera, good value!!
customer_reviews.author: dWb116327

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Great camera whether your a novice or an expert! Set it to Auto for novices and you get great pictures. If you have lots of experience or want to gain more experience, this camera has all the settings and functions to enhance your picture taking capabilities. The software that accompanies it provides easy editing and I especially like the feature of being able to print my pictures with or without the date or a title. The battery supplied provides plenty of shoot time, however purchasing an extra one provides the additional conveniance of never running out of battery power, plus being able to use the batteries until totally disvharged, which enhances battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Davey

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used this camera for a few months. The instructions are complex, but the photos taken with the automatic point and shoot setting are excellent, so that it's a question of how sophisticated one wants to get with the settings. The 18X power is terrific. The camera comes with plenty of excellent free software. I would get a spare battery to keep charged up at all times. A 4GB card is also helpful, though we have been having trouble with the card readers and have had to use the provided USB cable to download directly from the SD card still loaded in the camera. A great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: gernab

customer_reviews.title: Quality Photos - Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The quality and design of the hardware are just OK but the quality of the photos is very good. Great for sports and wildlife. Fast recycle time. Good battery life. If you can take to so-so quality and feel of the hardware (ie - compared to Canon) the quality of the lens and processor make for great pictures. Reasonably intuitive menus as well. Also very light weight for its size. No regrets from me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: The LUMIX is so versatile I am still learning how to employ all of its features. But the one thing I really use a lot when taking photos of my grandson is LUMIX's burst photo taking property. The burst property takes a rapid series of photos, almost like shooting a vide. To catch a toddler in just the right pose requires patience or luck. The photo burst capability makes one more likely to catch the perfect candid shot.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware Den

customer_reviews.title: it works great an now I can take pictures of my grandchildren ...
customer_reviews.text: i was in the dec 2015 flood an this exact camera was something I cherished cause my daughter had given it to me a few months earlier an when I found out it ,it was damaged in the flood I wanted to cry...then I decided to try to replace it by looking on amazon an when I saw it I had to have it...it works great an now I can take pictures of my grandchildren an a great grandson that was born right after the flood
customer_reviews.author: linda thorne

customer_reviews.title: Novice Shooter
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything I was hoping it whould be. I had a 10x optical Panasonic, but since it did not have a viewfinder, I found it difficult to take outdoor pictures. Since there are not "small" cameras with 10x or more that also have a viewfinder, I decided to go for the "larger" camera that has all the bells and whistles that I desire.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Panasonic camera. My first was the DMC-FZ7 and I'm extremly pleased with the Leica lens and the quality of pictures. I use the Macro feature a lot for doing close ups of small trademarks and logos on products that we sell on Ebay. That was my major reason for buying this camera and I have not been dissapointed yet.
customer_reviews.author: second 53

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, love the zoom and the pictures but...
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes amazing quality photos. A great value. Only thing I would do differently is purchase a 48 mm clear uv lens which will screw into the existing lens and give you protection from scratches. The stock lens cover will fit on top. When I purchased this camera, I also purchased theand it is way too complicated and bulky. All the lenses and stuff do not fit in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: RGalvantx

customer_reviews.title: Most bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: The Leica lens alone sets this excellent camera apart from its competitors, and the myriad of other features makes it a singularly great buy. For 99% of photographers and an equal percentage of photo opportunities this is the only camera that one needs. Don't be sucked into the DSLR vortex: it's a never-ending cycle of additional purchases that this camera renders meaningless. Many professional photographers (the only ones who REALLY NEED DSLR technology) carry this camera with them and use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Meanoldbaldteacher

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier ---
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who was used to using his Nikon 35 millimeter. I can't comment on the more technical aspects but I can say that he loves this camera. He hasn't had any problems and the pictures that he's taken so far have been far better than he expected. All in all, great purchase; and, as usual, great buying experience with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera at a really good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It takes: great day time shots, very good shots with the flash, very nice videos, and even does well in dark situations with accent lighting (got some great shots at Mammoth Cave). It has plenty of options to let you pick what you want to be a priority during a shot. All of that, a great macro feature (man can you get in close and get wide too!), an excellent zoom with stabilization, and it's light weight too! Even my non-technical wife really likes this camera.
customer_reviews.author: SAVO

customer_reviews.title: Lumix Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: My family and I recently took a cruise to Alaska up the Inside Channel. The pictures we took were awesome, and the ease with which the camera did most of the work was incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rawie

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled
customer_reviews.text: I am having a hard time getting the colors of lanscapes to turn out nicely with this camera. Even with all the settings to switch between I cant find one to use regularly to take pictures of my backyard, they are either too dark or too bright. Either way it doesnt seem to catch the details as much as I would like. I am going to go for a Nikon next, my mom has a Nikon 4800 and it takes some great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Stephra

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMC-FZ18: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this camera! The Leica lens system's clarity and accuracy are the main reasons I stuck with Panasonic Lumix. The variety of features are more than I require. I have been able to take 18x optical zoom images hand held (no tripod) that are crisp, thanks to Panasonic's excellent image stabilization. Easy to use - pretty intuitive. Light weight and compact to boot! This camera is definitely worth consideration in its price class.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: It's 8 years later and I still use this great camera. The auto setting makes it very easy to take beautiful photos. The videos it takes are excellent. I have had this camera for almost a month now and absolutly love it. I have taken some aweseome photos of elk,geese, horses and other things. the camera is so much faster at taking photos than my HP camera. and the zoom well its wonderful. i haven't learned how to use everything yet, but what i have used has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I was just about to get an Olympus Evolt 510 DSLR when I kept coming across such great reviews on this camera. I know nothing about digital cameras and decided against a DSLR and went with this camera in black. The camera is beyond easy to use, which was the real selling point. It takes really good pictures and I could not be happier with my purchase. Beware of cheaper prices, make sure you are not getting a "grey market camera". Deal with Amazon and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with my purchase. Camera works well and even for a beginner, it's easy to try the different settings and get fantastic results. I would recommend this camera to anyone. I am hoping that panasonic will come up with an underwater housing for this product. So far this camera beats all the other ones I used to own, canon elph, sea and sea 860 G with the underwater housing. Really no jokes, a fantastic purchase. I will try other panasonic items for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle Tache

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lunix DMC-FZ18S review
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with this camera. The picture quality is good, the 18X zoom is great, and the size is just right. However, I found following "cons": 1. no zooming during taking video. 2. the build felt a little cheap, plastic like (well it is plastic, so maybe I am too picky :-)) 3. it is hard to find filters for it, you need to pay something like $80 to buy an adapter from Panasonic/ebay before you can put 58mm UV/Polarized on it. I use polarized filter all the time. 4. if I would buy this camera again, I will choose black version, because the silver version does not look "silver" instead it looks more like gray.
customer_reviews.author: Jie Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the camera about a month, so I haven't had a chance to try all the features, but so far I am more than impressed by it. I primarily use my camera at concerts and I always ended up with 2 or 3 decent shots and a lot of blurry and/or too dark ones. With this one, I turn it on Auto and get perfect pictures. It is super easy to use too. I got mine the day I was leaving for vacation and right out of the box I was able to start taking great shots. My only regret is that I didn't buy a Lumix sooner.
customer_reviews.author: starr

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW. This camera is everything I expected and more. Takes pictures every bit as nice as my old SLR (maybe even better). The zoom is incredible. Would recommend to anyone who is an amateur photographer and doesn't want to drop at least a grand to get a great camera. The only con so far is that Panasonic has been very slow with making the accessories available in the US.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Orth

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful camera I just need to learn how to do more with it. But you can just point and shoot which is awesome. I learn more every day.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M. Pyott

customer_reviews.title: Good camera!
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are great, and it's very easy to use. The zoom is awesome! The only things I would change would be the quality of sound when doing videos - could be better, my small camera does better - and i wish we could zoom in and out while making movies. Overall, a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Neli H.

customer_reviews.title: Very favorably impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from Canon S2IS I wanted the somewhat stronger telephoto for wildlife but find myself loving the wide angle for scenery. The fully automatic setting is getting me photos that I didn't used to get because it took too long to punch in the settings. I shoot telephoto from a paraglider and the image stabilzation really matters
customer_reviews.author: Peter Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Loving my Lumix
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my old digital camera, I checked on-line reviews and decided on a Lumix DMC-FZ185 digital camera. Good choice! The zoom lens is powerful and easy to use. The prints are crisp. I still haven't mastered the Panasonic-supplied editing software, but the images are easy to transfer to other software. I recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: C. Megarry

customer_reviews.title: All Around Good
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much like any normal point and shoot but with a really good lens! The movies are amazing on the camera and that's just all do to a really good leans. If you want a really good point and shoot, don't go get thous ones that are 400-500 bucks with little lenses. Get this one!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Federowicz

customer_reviews.title: Exellent Camera & price
customer_reviews.text: If you are not a professional, don't waste your money on DSLR. This camera will do every thing for you! The Leica Lens is excellent. The wide selection of Scene choices give plenty of opportunities for experimentation. yet the camera can be used as point and shoot by a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Angiemar Alejandra Aranguren

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to buy DSLR - this is good enough
customer_reviews.text: I can hold for DSLR price drop for another 2 years with this camera. The Silver looks better than Black. The lens is already worth the most money. If you are not a professional, don't waste your money on DSLR. This camera will do every thing for you! I've reseached consumer cameras for months so you can trust me! (go to popphoto review if you don't) Vanns is the best place to purchase cameras over the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Li

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this camera! Sophisticated yet easy. My father-in-law said it's "too much camera" for me so I can't wait to see what all it can do. I bought it on a recommendation and highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: W. Downs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pictures with no effort. You will not be disappointed. Well made, feature packed, right price. Got an extra battery for $4, which can not be beat. Go Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - delivers as promised-best of class
customer_reviews.text: My sister is an avid birder and she selected this camera after months of diligent research. she needs the clear pictures, the long zoom and the steady feature. They all work extremely well. Now my girlfriends has bought one too and she is equally happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic FZ18S
customer_reviews.text: This camera is everything it was advertised to be. If you are looking for a versatile camera that is reasonably priced, this is the one!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: It is as good as I expected...The
customer_reviews.text: The camera is just as good as I expected, and arrived at the estimated time.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Decarvalho

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18S 8.1MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Panasonic has expanded its Lumix family of digital still cameras with the introduction of the Lumix DMC-FZ18, an 8.1-megapixel compact camera with an impressive 18x optical zoom. In addition to a premium 28mm wide-angle Leica D C lens, the DMC-FX18 is one of the first Panasonic digital cameras to offer the revolutionary Intelligent Auto Mode, which includes Face De tection, Intelligent Scene Selector, and Continuous Autofocus functions, allowing users t o easily capture clear, professional-quality images in any situation or setting.

 When this powerful camera--which features image-stabilized optical zoom up to 18 x--is put into Intelligent Auto Mode, the multifaceted functions engage automatically, so there is no need to adjust s ettings every time conditions change. The DMC-FZ18's intuitive Intelligent Auto Mode comprises : 

 * Intelligent Scene Selector, which automatically selects the appropriate scene mode from the most frequently-used modes such as Portrait, Scenery, Macro, Night Scen ery, and Night Portrait; 
 * Face Detection System, which helps the camera to focus, set autoexposure, an d detects up to 15 human faces, capturing them clearly and brightly; and 
 * Continuous Autofocus, which allows the camera to keep focus on the subject w ithout having to press the shutter button halfway and allowing for the best results out of a shutter chance by minimizing the autofocus time.

Similar to the entire 2007 line of Lumix digital still cameras, the camera sport s advanced countermeasures against blurring--the Intelligent Image Stabilization system tha t combines MEGA Optical Image Stabilization (O.I.S.) to compensate for hand-shake and Intel ligent ISO Control to detect and adjust for motion blur caused by subject movement. The Lumix DMC-FZ18 also is equipped with a 2.5-inch large, high-resolution LCD w ith 207,000 pixels, a 0.44-inch electric viewfinder with 188,000 pixels and f2.8 brightness, and is powered by the high-quality, high-performance Venus Engine III, which boasts shooting at IS O 1600 in normal recording mode.

 The DMC-FZ18 has been redesigned to make the camera more stylish and easier to u se. The autofocus, autoexposure lock, and Macro buttons are now independent, to allow qu ick and direct operation. A metal-finished mode dial adds design strength, and an enhanc ed rubber grip makes the camera easier to hold. The redesigned body also incorporates the joyst ick made popular by the DMC-FZ8 model, which enables a host of settings, such as manual f ocusing and exposure, to be done quickly and easily.

 Other advanced features of the Lumix DMC-FZ18 include:


 * Custom Setting Mode that memorizes your frequent setting patterns for in stance use applied by simply selecting this function on the mode dial. 
 * 1920 x 1080 pixel photos ideal for full-screen viewing on a wide-screen HDTV . 
 * Six autofocusing methods including face detection, multi, three-point high-s peed, one-point high speed, one-point normal speed, and spot. With the one-point autofocus or spot autofocus method, the autofocusing area can be chosen from as many as 11 points with the joystick or cursor button. 
 * Advanced Scene Modes provide users more control over some frequently used sc ene modes, such as indoor and outdoor modes, when selecting portrait or sports mode and nature or architecture settings when selecting portrait mode. 
 * Bundled SILKYPIX Developer Studio 2.0SE software application for editing and developing images in the RAW file format. 
 * 27MB of built-in memory--perfect for backing up SDHC/SD memory card recordin g. 
 * Extra Optical Zoom feature extends zoom power to 28.7x at 3 megapixels. 
 * Compatibility with large-capacity SDHC memory cards. 
 * Title Edit Function allows inputting of text and additional picture informat ion. 
 * Picture Playback by category sorts images into categories such as portraits, landscapes, nightscapes, events, and motion pictures. Also, allows slideshow pla yback of images in the same category. 
 * Optional accessories including a teleconversion lens, close-up lens, ND filt er, MC protector, lens adapter, AC adapter, battery pack, soft case, and camera bag. 
 * Available in two colors: silver and black.

What's in the box
Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ18 digital camera, ArcSoft MediaImpression and ArcSoft Pan oramaMaker software, USB driver, battery charger, battery pack, lens cap, lens h ood, lens hood adapter, AV cable, USB connection cable, strap, CD-ROM
feature_bullets: 8.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
18x wide-angle image-stabilized optical zoom; 2.5-inch LCD display; 0.44-inch electric viewfinder
Intelligent Auto Mode with Face Detection and Intelligent Scene Selector
Shooting at ISO 1600 in normal recording mode; 6 autofocusing modes
Stores images on SD memory cards (includes 27MB of internal memory; powered by lithium-ion battery (battery and charger included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars54 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
